p: The antifungal activity of the hydrogel supplemented with 100 mg/g BTEO concentration was demonstrated against all tested Candida strains, except for C. parapsilosis (clinical strain). Essential oils are well-known antifungal agents. Many of them inhibited both the growth and the activity of Candida strains more efficiently than known antifungal drugs [ 13]. The highest activity was observed against C. tropicalis and C. krusei (3.7 mm difference compared to hydrogel without BTEO). In the case of the bigel formulation with essential oil, the growth inhibition zone diameters were observed in C. glabrata (mean of diameters 8.0 mm), C. tropicalis, and both C. parapsilosis strains (mean 7.7 mm). The minimum antifungal activity of the oleogel in combination with BTEO (mean 7 mm) was demonstrated only for the clinical C. krusei strain, and for individual measurements of C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019, C. tropicalis and C. glabrata (mean of diameters 6.3 mm). The results of the antifungal activity of the prepared formulations are shown in Table 3.
